body_html:
@AFAgarap We plan on CUDA 8 support to come officially in TensorFlow version 0.11rc1.

In general there is no difference in features between our binary and source releases at a particular version. I.e. our binaries are built out of our sources at a particular version.

In the meantime if you're building from sources, and want to use CUDA 8, you'll need to ensure you have a fresh enough version of the sources, that hasn't introduced some other silly bug. Once 0.11rc1 has been released you can just use that as a stable point in the codebase.
